name: happycat
text: Whenever you die, everything you say is important which is why you have to talk in capitals all the time. I think, anyway.

name: jesler729
text: With your arms outstretched.

name: jesler729
text: Constantly

name: norsef
text: I think it's just to stop him losing his hands in the folds. Anyone who remembers the shirts their mums used to buy them when the hurricane of puberty first came by will know what this is like.

name: redjoker
text: even in heaven capslock is apparently cruise control  for cool

name: zem
text: Fantastic

name: abe
text: A bita' metaphysical yoo-mah..

name: ghostd
text: I love the idea of a ghost of a recently departed friend visiting you, and fixing your van. That's like double awesome.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: How's he going to get the rag inside the truck? Will he pick up the rag's soul?

name: wonelove
text: He's still getting used to all the spectral stuff.

name: m3funkyb
text: that must really come in handy

name: cicadalek
text: I just noticed his paws/hands are still black.

name: stuart
text: Only here. Second time out it's fixed to match.

name: dybrar
text: Blister was wearing his car fixin' gloves.

name: spectre
text: "I DON'T REALLY REMEMBER" -- you come back from the dead, and you're still the same irresponsible careless fuckwad you were in real life.

name: quantumcasaba
text: Also perhaps still stoned.

name: philosophe
text: This comic would be damn funny if it ended after the 6th panel: "Can you walk through things?" "TOTALLY" (end)

name: philosophe
text: I do like this one, though. I gave it a 5

name: umbra
text: yes, he could have been cheap and split this into two strips, but He passes the savings on to us!

name: envika
text: my thoughts exactly

name: spinynorman
text: I didn't scroll down at first so that's exactly where I thought it ended.

name: fineoakstructure
text: In the book it's extremely easy to read it like that, because the first six panels are on one page and you have to flip over to get the "second half" of the strip (it's very easy to miss the "continued..." note in the book).

name: tekende
text: I used to have this book of Peanuts cartoons that didn't make any damn sense. Some pages would have like two or three panels on them and it was never very clear where one strip ended and another began. It really frustrated me.

name: snowman
text: i thought that too!  this one could have been split into 2 awesome strips.

name: mashisoyo
text: I thought it did, until I scrolled down. It was damn funny.

name: mashisoyo
text: Oh man, spinynorman already said this. I thought he hadn't, until I scrolled down. Now I feel like a damn fool.

name: crinklebat
text: It's funnier if you picture him talking in like the most stereotypical ghosty voice.

name: fineoakstructure
text: I always picture Blister as sounding very similar to the Cybernetic Ghost of Christmas Past from the Future from Aqua Teen...a little less metallic, but a deep voice with serious tones and heavy reverb.  And just like the Cybernetic Ghost, such a voice makes colloquialisms likes "TOTALLY" sound so much funnier.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: i think it was blister that first got me thinking, 'damn, i could really get into this comic'

name: _cheesekayke
text: How the hell did Blister get into heaven?

name: anitrophaeron
text: Damn.  Do you think Blister does house calls?  This just reminded me that my oxygen sensor has needed attention for the last three months or so.

name: belgand
text: I think I may need to start going to a mechanic that has the undead on staff. This is just far too useful.

name: tomsonlocal
text: The silence in panel 5 speaks volumes. You meet a friend who has just died, you can ask him about what it felt like to die, what Heaven is actually like and if he spoke to God in the afterlife. More importantly, you could just ask if they are able to walk through things. Magic.

name: cobra_lionfist
text: I love panel 5 because it features the realization that Todd is smarter than someone.

name: quarantine
text: Achewood needs more Blister.

name: gsurge
text: For some reason, the first time I read this, I read it right-to-left. It made just as much sense.

name: buttermoths
text: The first six panels are indeed quite humorous when read  right-to-left. What kind of sense did you make of the last six?

name: xerol
text: Those must be some tiny tools.

name: sticks
text: I think Todd ran him over with his van, then changed the name for the song.

name: em2
text: The first six panels alone are a five. The next six are just gravy.

name: beansdooma
text: blister doesnt show up enough any more

name: coco
text: The silence in panel 5 says everything. I'm sure that if it had been Skamper who came back and not Blister, the awkward silence would have lasted several more panels . . .

name: snowman
text: MORE BLISTER PLZ THX

name: mc_white
text: You know you got a good friend when they'll help clean your oxygen sensor from beyond the grave

name: red-barchetta
text: I love Todd's reaction to Blister going into the van and the changes in the last 4 panels.

name: phthano
text: Why does he need a rag? He [i]does[i] have a robe, after all.

name: elzilcho
text:
Alright so I know Blister does not have wings. He is dead, but he does not have wings. He has a halo. He has a robe. No wings in his spine.

Yet to this day, when I listen to "Two-Headed Boy, Part Two", I still mix my Anne Frank imagery up with thoughtful meditations on a dead squirrel.

I-it kinda changes the song?

name: puguglypress
text: I wish that this one was just the first six panels

name: zeitgeist
text:
Magnificent.
It's interesting how this one could work as the first 3, 6, 9, or all 12 panels.
